attributes.action: Stop the CCG from cutting NHS funded IVF services in Suffolk.
attributes.background:
Keeping NHS funded IVF services will impact on so many people's lives by allowing them to have the family they've always wanted.
It would be so unfair to take away an opportunity for people to have a family when they cannot conceive themselves.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.hsj.co.uk/hsj-local/commissioners/nhs-ipswich-and-east-suffolk-ccg/more-south-east-ccgs-plan-cuts-to-ivf-services/7008343.fullarticle

attributes.action: Make sure all disabled people can have the adaptations they need
attributes.background:
Disabled Facilities Grants adapt people’s homes to be safe and suitable.

Current funding is not enough to provide everyone with the adaptations they need. 

We petition you to calculate the annual need for DFG funding at a local authority level, and ensure that this funding need is met.
attributes.additional_details:
A 2011 report by the BRE stated: “the total amount required… is £1.9bn.”

The total funding over the last 5 years was £1 billion - only half of what’s needed.

Though funding will rise by 2019/20, there is no assurance that it will meet the need.

Isle of Wight Council have found that every £1 invested in DFGs could return £7.30 a year in social care savings.

In the past 5 years, the government may have missed savings of more than £47 billion in social care costs.

This needs to change.

Thank you.

attributes.action: Hold public consultation on NHS Sustainability and Transformation Footprints
attributes.background: By June 2016, forty four geographical areas in England are to produce a five year NHS Sustainability and Transformation plans showing that they would balance their budget by eliminating all deficits in this financial year and implement new models of care as laid out in the Five Year Forward View.
attributes.additional_details: We believe that this would have a profound effect on the delivery of local health services. It should be noted that none of these plans are based on evidence or assessment of clinical needs. Furthermore the plans have not been discussed in the House of Commons and there has been no public consultation. We demand that the government should launch an urgent public consultation on this major reorganisation of the NHS.

attributes.action: Permanent 'dogs die in hot cars' signs to be in all public car parks.
attributes.background: Despite constant public messages and awareness raising people continue to leave their dogs locked in hot cars. This is unacceptable and many dogs suffer. The law is also very unclear on what direct action members of the public can take. A dog can die in the time it takes for police to attend.
attributes.additional_details: Permanent signs in all public car parks, give traffic wardens the power to break car window in an emergency and clear up and improve rights of the general public to intervene if necessary.

attributes.action: Cruelty over Chinese dog meat festival should be raised with the Chinese gov
attributes.background: Chinese population has eaten dog meat for the last 400 years. A festival is held annually in Yulin, Guangxi, China during the Summer solstice in June. About 10,000 to 15,000 dogs are consumed over a 10 day period.
attributes.additional_details:
The dogs are often not killed humanely. Dogs are often beaten to death as the Chinese like adrenaline soaked meat. 

Since the local government denies any official involvement or endorsement of the festival then this should be something that can be raised quite easily with the Chinese government. 

I accept the Chinese right to eat Dog as we eat Cow, Sheep etc. My objection is that the dogs are frightened an abused before inhumainly killed. Please can you debate I feel that there is little I can do, so looking for my government to help.

attributes.action: Clarify to public the many contributions to education brought by EU membership
attributes.background: Contributions include opportunities for young people to study and work in other EU countries, for teachers to share effective practice, funded project opportunities through Lingua and Erasmus +, support for research enabling major projects to be undertaken, social and cultural links at all levels.
attributes.additional_details: The significant contributions to educational purposes that have been brought by EU membership extend across the curriculum and beyond the education system. The Language Alliance supports this petition; we are a broad-based independent Forum, created in 2002, aiming to bring to the attention of a wider public the importance of language to the development of community understanding and empowerment on a local, national or international level; members attend on a personal basis.

attributes.action: Introduce the Varicella Zoster (Chickenpox) into the UK Childhood Immunisations.
attributes.background: Chickenpox is pretty much unheard of in the USA, Japan and Germany. A vaccination was approved in 1995 and has been used for 20 years. It  was combined with the MMR vaccine creating an MMRV vaccine in 2005. The World Health Organisation includes it as one of children's vital immunisations.
attributes.additional_details:
Chickenpox complications include severe skin infections, scars, brain damage and death. There is no reason children should suffer these complications when there is a safe vaccine already available. 
Studies have confirmed that the cost to the NHS would be offset by not having to deal with chickenpox complications, antibiotics prescribed, hospital, GP appointments aswell as time taken off work by parents caring for children infected with Chickenpox.

attributes.action: Refuges for domestic violence victims MUST be exempt from housing benefit cap.
attributes.background: Refuges for domestic violence victims rely on getting their full rent per room so they can stay open, some local authorities are already refusing funding in the belief that many of these desperately needed refuges may close when the cap is brought in. It is unacceptable that they lose any funding.
attributes.additional_details: As seen on BBC breakfast, these brave women and children will have nowhere else to go. Many don't have a secure location to escape to, and even in refuges can often be tracked down, and in extreme cases even killed. We must insure, not only that they stay open, but be better and more sustainably funded. We need many more refuges, not many less. Thousands of families of abusive partners owe their lives to these refuges, which give them a chance to change identity and live full and secure lives.

attributes.action: Cats not in an approved breeding programme should be microchipped and neutered.
attributes.background: Female cats can become pregnant at 4 months and give birth at 6 months.  This is not good for anyone involved. A legal requirement for neutering, plus compulsory microchipping to enable cat owners to be identified, would prevent this happening, and also take the pressure off cat rescue centres.
attributes.additional_details: At my local rescue centre alone, there are presently around 40 kittens, and things will most likely get worse as the summer progresses.  It happens every year, and the situation is repeated in rescue centres up and down the country, mainly due to owner ignorance and/or lack of responsibility.  Compulsory microchipping and neutering of cats would go some way towards preventing this, and would result in happier, healthier cats.

attributes.action: Review the limitations for Red Arrows air displays this year in particular FIA.
attributes.background: The new CAA regulations regarding air show displays have led to a review of the Red Arrow displays this year most importantly at the Farnborough International Airshow. The Red Arrows have always been an important part of the FIA, and safety has always been upmost in their display.

attributes.action: Don't tax Adult Colouring Books as they are a therapy
attributes.background: So I am an avid colouring therapy addict, just like thousands of people across the world and now the British government are trying to tax our therapy. We do this to escape from a lot of things in life for many it is the only luxury they have. Please don't tax our colour therapy

attributes.action: The Government should publish its plans should the Country vote to leave the EU.
attributes.background: Having offered the voters the choice of remaining or leaving the EU they should tell the voters what they would do in the event of either result. This would better inform the voter, reduce uncertainty and reduce some of the economic damage till the vote and demonstrate they have thought it through.

attributes.action: One electronic recording system to safeguard all children and young people
attributes.background: Safeguarding is the responsibility of all agencies, yet we don't all have access to the same system for recording.  We all hold pieces to the puzzle but don't have access to the 'big picture'.  We can only safeguard our young people, if professionals work together to put the pieces together.
attributes.additional_details: Legislation 'Keeping Children Safer in Education' specifies the legal duty for anyone working in Education.  We should have one clear piece of legislation that involves all agencies and states 'What we should do, how we should all work together to achieve it and how we record it.' Too many young people are slipping the net, through agencies not sharing and recording information on the same system.   Lessons learnt from serious case reviews, repeatedly comment on lack of shared communication.

attributes.action: Condemn Guatemala for it's aggression and belligerence against Belize
attributes.background: Guatemala continues to show aggression towards Belize. Not respecting Territorial Borders of Belize by repeatedly encroaching into Belize Waters in the Sarstoon River. Arresting and confining Civilians in Belize waters and threatening Belize Military Forces in the Sarstoon area.
attributes.additional_details: Since 2007, Guatemala has repeatedly aggressed against Belize, refused to respect its borders and allowed it's citizens to pillage and steal Belizean forest products, create Milpas in Belize National Parks including the growing of Marijuana. They have threatened the Belize Defence Forces and crossed into Belize waters a number of time to prevent the legal passage of both Belizean civilians and the B D F. Failed in their duty to convict the murderer of Belize Policeman Danny Conorquie last year.

attributes.action: Urge the Chinese government to stop the Yulin Dog Eating Festival in 2016
attributes.background: Thousands of dogs are tortured to death during the annual Yulin Dog Meat festival. They are skinned alive, beaten to death, burned with blowtorches and dismembered while still alive. Many dogs are stolen family pets - they still have their collars on. Yulin began in 2009, it is not 'tradition.'
attributes.additional_details: Officials have said Yulin does not exist, or that it is 'on the decline,' but the horrific pictures and press reports from 2014 and 2015 say otherwise (#stopyulin). Please sign this petition to ask the UK government to reach out to the Chinese government this year to intervene and stop this barbaric event in 2016. Sign this petition if you believe it is a matter of urgency that the UK government take this action in 2016.

attributes.action: Introduce compulsory voting and also a 'none of the above' box on ballot papers
attributes.background: With constant low turnouts for UK elections it always favours the establishment as they will always get their voters out which can be enough in areas who only have 30/40% turnout. We favour an Australian-style compulsory voting as long as they got a 'none of the above' box on the ballot paper.

attributes.action: Stop housing asylum seekers at airport hotels
attributes.background: 300 plus asylum seekers have been housed at Britannia airport hotel close to Manchester airport  a major British airport local residents find this unacceptable and unsafe since Brussels airport bombings

attributes.action: Give Ofcom power to enforce impartiality and accuracy of the BBC
attributes.background: Giving Ofcom the power to enforce this policy, for accurate information is essential to democracy. At present the BBC is failing the nation, discarding all pretence at impartiality and balanced reporting, becoming a voice for an international elite, & suppressing news not welcome to its own agenda.
attributes.additional_details:
The BBC has a unique position in British life; funded by the people individually, it belongs to all & has an ethical & constitutional duty to provide accurate & unbiased information & balanced comment. It has lamentably failed this duty in recent years, in Referendum debates, and even more so afterwards by hysterically talking down the future prospects of the country, increasing division, distrust, & anger & encouraging anxiety & fear in the young
more at http://www.facebook.com/BBCNewsPetition

attributes.action: Stop the sale and production of genetically modified foods in the uk
attributes.background: These foods are incredibly damaging to our health and environment. The dangers of genetically modified foods has been proven and other countries in Europe have already banned them. I believe that the people of the uk deserve safe nutritious food

attributes.action: Call For The Government To Act On Tax Havens After Leak
attributes.background: The Government has promised and failed to end tax secrecy and crack down on 'morally unacceptable' offshore schemes.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2011, the Prime Minister said: "We need to shine a spotlight on who owns what and where the money is really flowing.”
Real action is now needed after the biggest ever data leak revealed details about clients of a Panama-based law firm.

attributes.action: Legislation that requires all products list their content of aluminium as mg/L
attributes.background: Aluminium is ubiquitous in everyday products. Human exposure to aluminium is rising every year. Contrary to the official view that aluminium is benign in humans, there is growing research showing myriad links with neurological conditions such as Alzheimer's disease.
attributes.additional_details:
Unlike almost any other known toxin, there is no legislation to limit human exposure to aluminium and no legal requirement to list its content on any product. This petition asks that the public be informed about their unwitting exposure to aluminium in everyday life.
For more information visit: keele.ac.uk/aluminium

attributes.action: Pass the same sentences for offences against animals as offences against humans
attributes.background: Every day you hear of terrible offences against animals, including cruelty, torture and murder. I propose the same sentencing for perpetrators of these crimes as there would be if they had committed the same offence against a human. The current sentences passed are too light.

attributes.action: Scrap Energy Performance Certificates
attributes.background: EPCs (Energy Performance Certificates) were introduced as a mandatory requirement for all UK residential property sales from 2007 (originally as part of the failed Home Information Pack). This derived from an EU diktat, European Union Directive 2002/91/EC. Later, this applied to rental properties

attributes.action: Provide funding for a specialist music teacher in every primary school.
attributes.background: The racism and xenophobia surrounding the EU Referendum has demonstrated the need for better music education in our schools in order to teach our children about other cultures, create safe spaces where children feel a sense of well-being, joy, togetherness and purpose.
attributes.additional_details: Primary schools often don't have a specialist; budgets are squeezed. Music stimulates cognitive development, enhancing everything from language to mathematics and empathy; it helps children to succeed at school and far into adulthood. The younger we learn the better. The experience of music allows children to build human understanding across differences of ​culture, creed, and race. Music-making builds a happy society: you make friends in choirs and orchestras; concerts are uplifting.

attributes.action: Make the death of a cat by a dog a criminal offence.
attributes.background: My dearly loved 19 year old pet cat, Chip, was killed by a dog mauling him to death however we were informed that due to my Chip not being classed as 'property' by law, if the victim of this dog had been another dog, pig, goat etc then the police could have prosecuted.
attributes.additional_details: A new law came into effect in October 2014 which gives police the power to prosecute dog owners however I don't believe that this law goes far enough, it should go further and include the option of the removal of the dog from the owner or even the dog being destroyed in extreme cases if a professional body such as the rspca believes the dog is a permanent danger to cats.

attributes.action: Reconsider legisltive changes that are intended to apply to the BSPS Pension
attributes.background: Steelworkers have worked in the industry under TATA management. They paid into the pension scheme, that had defined benefits on retirement. Its wrong that an ex employee should have that entitlement reduced whilst several known branches of the company continue to extract revenue from our economy.

attributes.action: Investigate an incinerator at Rivenhall outputting 500,000 tonnes of CO2
attributes.background: In 2010 the secretary of state approved an IWMF at Rivenhall with bio mass generator and an incinerators for solid recovered fuels. This was approved for planning without an EA permit on the 26th Feb 2016 via a S73 variation that reduces Bio Mass by 70% whilst increasing Incinerated waste by 60%
attributes.additional_details: The new plant now produces only 28Mw power is being built at risk (no EA permit) and is relying on the change process. The changes in the plant capacities move it DOWN the wast hierarchy not up. The new plant will disperse poisonous gasses over Essex prime farm land and historic housing. In addition the plant will produce some 500,000 tones of CO2 that is totally contrary to the current thinking and is not sustainable. The planners have allowed this to progress at risk.

attributes.action: Stop the £20,000 personal tax free allowance the current and any future PM gets.
attributes.background: The UK Prime Minister can benifit from a Personal Tax Allowance (PTL) of £20,000 whilst everyone else's PTL is only £11,000. This is called the 'prime ministerial expenses deduction' it's for expenses whilst living for free in 10 Downing Street. I think everybody's PTL should be the same.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.itv.com/news/2016-04-10/in-depth-david-camerons-personal-financial-records/

https://www.google.co.uk/search?q=tax+free+allowance+for+prime+minister&rlz=1CDGOYI_enGB673GB673&oq=tax+free+allowance+for+prime+minister+&aqs=chrome..69i57.14961j0j4&hl=en-GB&sourceid=chrome-mobile&ie=UTF-8

attributes.action: Ensure that the United Kingdom remains in the European Economic Area (EEA)
attributes.background: On 23 June the United Kingdom voted to leave the European Union. The outcome of the referendum must now be respected. However, over 48% of voters expressed a desire to remain in the EU.
attributes.additional_details: For well over a generation, we have taken for granted the economic, political and travel benefits of EU - and EEC - membership. While there is now a popular mandate for a negotiated withdrawal from the EU, it is also essential that the interests be respected of over 48% of voters who wish to retain the benefits of being in the EU. The best way to do this is through membership of the European Economic Area (EEA).

attributes.action: Stop Myxomatosis killing wild Rabbits by developing a lifetime vaccine
attributes.background: Myxomatosis is cruel disease which millions of wild rabbits in the UK die from each year. It is not acceptable that such a disease is left unchecked due to it being released illegally in the UK in the 1950’s. Myxomatosis is pure torture for any wild rabbit infected.
attributes.additional_details: They suffer severe conjunctivitis that results in blindness, swelling in the head, ears, eyes and genitals, thick pus discharge from the nose (which makes it difficult to breathe), and lumps on the body for up to two weeks before they die; longer in many cases. Rabbits are sentient beings, who feel pain and suffer every bit as any other animal. I want the Government to actively discuss all the options open to it to combat/control this disease in the wild rabbit population.

attributes.action: Ensure that the Brexit EU deal maintains free trade, research, and movement.
attributes.background: After the Leave vote, we must ensure that the rights and prosperity of UK citizens are protected. We believe that this means any deal should ensure our rights as UK citizens to live and work around the EU, maintain single market access to protect British jobs, and continue academic collaboration.
attributes.additional_details: Such a deal would likely be similar to that between the EU and Norway; whilst this may involve the UK continuing to pay some EU budget contributions, we accept the views of most economists that single market access is valuable enough to make this worthwhile. This deal will likely involve accepting free movement into Britain, too, and we welcome this; EU migrants are at the heart of British life, playing a vital role in many economic sectors but more importantly being our neighbours and friends.

attributes.action: The law on WPA (widowed parents allowance) needs to be updated.
attributes.background: Currently those with children who are not married are not entitled to financial help with bereavement payments.
attributes.additional_details:
The discrimination of children from cohabiting couples rather than married ones is inconsistent with our human rights policy.
Please sign this petition to force the government to bring this benefit to all vulnerable families not only those with married parents.

attributes.action: In the event of exit from the European Union a general election should be called
attributes.background: David Cameron has led the stay in the European Union if he loses he therefore has lost the backing of the country, he is tryingt to sell out our sovereignty and our identity.  The ploy to use Obama to tell us how we are better of in Europe when his own country would not water down their sovereignty

attributes.action: Childcare providers should be paid by direct payment
attributes.background: Parents/ Carers claiming the childcare element for childcare get paid into their accounts and then pass it on to their childcare provider. As a childcare provider I think it would be easier by paying the provider direct by the Inland Revenue.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum in London to become an independent city state
attributes.background:
The EU referendum has shown a significant disparity between the future that Londoners see for themselves and that of the rest of the country. 
Citizens of an independent London may be more prosperous and happy as a city state and being members of the EU.

attributes.action: NHS to encourage the treatment of type 2 diabetes with a low carbohydrate diet.
attributes.background: Professor Taylor has shown that Type 2 diabetes can be reversed using a low carbohydrate, low calorie diet.  The NHS has announced it is rolling out a programme to give pre-diabetics lifestyle help. There is no mention of the blood sugar diet which pre-diabetics and diabetics should be following.
attributes.additional_details:
The programme will cost £7 million pounds to run. The dietary advice will be the same as that currently being followed.  We have a diabetes epidemic so the old advice is not working.
Dr Maureen Baker, of the Royal College of GPs, welcomed the scheme but she warned "The long-term behaviour changes we need to see is hard to inspire".  However, there are forums for the Blood Sugar Diet which offer the support and inspiration needed which will also ease the burden on GP surgeries.

attributes.action: Make the use of closed systems to administer anticancer drugs (chemo) compulsory
attributes.background: Healthcare staff administering chemotherapy are at risk of exposure to these toxic agents. The agents are carcinogenic, mutagenic & teratogenic. Long term exposure can lead to health implications. The use of closed systems when administering these agents can reduce the risk to healthcare  workers.

attributes.action: Stop foreign men using marriage to live in the UK.
attributes.background: Marriage is a loophole in visa constraints. Abolishing the spouse visa would be for the common good, because England is over-crowded and the UK has more young men than young women. It would not prevent women from marrying foreign men because they can live in the husband's country, as is normal.
attributes.additional_details: This loophole for foreign men was closed in 1969 but was re-opened by the next Labour Home Secretary. The Conservatives promised to close the loophole again in their 1979 election manifesto, but did not keep their promise.

attributes.action: Improve Testing for Lyme disease in UK and Treatment Guidelines
attributes.background: Lyme disease within the UK is a big problem and the NHS is refusing to recognize this, leaving many patients to spend thousands on private treatment or suffer in silence

attributes.action: Ban the practice of Halal and Kosher slaughter in the UK
attributes.background: This petition believes that there is no place for the barbaric process of inhumane slaughter of livestock on religious grounds. Animals reared for meat for human consumption deserve the methods of slaughter which cause the least amount of suffering possible.

attributes.action: Stop the new INFRASTRUCTURE BILL.
attributes.background: This new bill will effectively privatize the Land Registry department. It means public land and asserts will now be In control of a private profit making company. This allow Fracking companies to set up in woodland, or parks, without public or council opposition.
attributes.additional_details: The government’s new Infrastructure Bill removes control for decisions to sell or develop publicly owned land from the public sector. In short, a private company will have the power to sell publicly owned land for Fracking, or whatever.The Infrastructure Bill has somehow managed to slip through to its Second Reading in the House of Lords from 1830 Wednesday 18th June 2014. The Bill contains a clause that will end local decision making over use of publicly owned land by councils or the public.

attributes.action: To help fund Menieres Disease, by researching treatments for sufferers.
attributes.background: Ménière's disease is a rare disorder that affects the inner ear. The disease of unknown cause affecting the membranous labyrinth of the ear, causing progressive deafness and attacks of tinnitus and vertigo. I am a 21 years old Ménière's sufferer and I would appreciate support in this worthy cause.
attributes.additional_details:
Ménière’s disease is a long term, progressive condition affecting the balance and hearing parts of the inner ear. Symptoms are acute attacks of vertigo (severe dizziness), fluctuating tinnitus, increasing deafness, and a feeling of pressure in the ear.
The disease can have a huge impact to everyday activities, social/work life. Unfortunately there is not a lot of awareness for Ménière’s disease and not of research is put into this due to funds, however I would like to change this for sufferers

attributes.action: Make legislation for toilet facilities to be provided for bus drivers on routes.
attributes.background: We want the UK Government to make legislation which will require bus operators and local authorities to provide adequate toilet facilities for bus drivers along their routes.

attributes.action: Cut Foreign Aid & use the money to increase the defence budget and armed forces
attributes.background:
We believe the the Government should reduce the Foreign Aid budget back to £8.4bn, the level it was at in 2010.
The Foreign Aid budget is set to rise to almost £16bn by 2020.
We believe this additional funding should be moved to beef up our defence capabilities and our marvellous armed forces.
attributes.additional_details:
The Foreign Aid budget is too high and is subject to abuse.
We believe that the budget should be reduced to £8.4bn & the commitment of a minimum of 2% GDP on defence spending is increased.
Our armed forces are amongst the best in the world.
We should reflect this by boosting our defence budget & spending on our armed forces.
In an ever more dangerous world, we should spend more on beefing up our defence budget.
We believe that the best way to achieve this is to cut Foreign Aid & boost Defence

attributes.action: Make DWP disability assessment providers supply video recording equipment.
attributes.background: Many people attending disability assessments have memory problems and cannot remember what was said and done during their face to face assessments. Providing a video recording of this assessment is a reasonable adjustment in the same way ramps are for wheelchair users and Braille is for the blind.
attributes.additional_details:
Additionally there seems to be a lot of corrupt assessors out there who are making a mockery of the system. As the only evidence that can prove an assessor lied is the recording of the assessment which they often refuse to allow it leaves the system in their favour. As we are often told if you are doing nothing wrong then you have nothing to hide. 

So should we record so the disabled person can remember or not record it so the assessor can lie.

attributes.action: Remove all French words from the cover of new British passports.
attributes.background: The vote to leave the EU means people voted to Take Back Control. Control of their borders, their culture and their language. Whether 'Dieu et mon droit' and 'Honi qui mal y pense' have existed as mottos in England for ages is irrelevant. French is an EU language and has no place on a UK passport.

attributes.action: Immediate force to combat  suicides in Veterans and Members of our Armed Forces
attributes.background: More Veterans and serving men and women killed them selves in 2012 than were lost during the Afghan war.
attributes.additional_details:
The facts speak for them selves. The deaths are continuing to rise and the government and parliament must make the forming of this force a priority .More Falkland veterans have killed them selves than were actually killed  during the Conflict in 1982.
We demand an immediate force of Veterans and professional people  be made into a new force which will be given priority, to help and stop our veterans and serving forces killing them selves.

attributes.action: All official campaign material for UK elections must be fact checked
attributes.background: We need to stop inaccurate or misleading information in official campaign materiel in elections and referendums (posters, leaflets posted to people, TV broadcasted, etc.). A neutral third party could be used to do this.
attributes.additional_details:
During the recent Brexit campaign, both slides used statistics that were widely regarded to be inaccurate - this needs to stop. 

In the past we could count on the media to do this, but it appears that we can no longer do this. 

We have official statistics and official and impartial organizations who publish statistics and perform fact checking these can be used.

attributes.action: Local Authority SEN Departments MUST be made accountable to statutory timescale.
attributes.background: This petition is to make Local Authority Special Educational Needs departments, accountable when failing to meet statutory guidelines, and those determined by Sendist. Local Authority's are currently not accountable when failing to meet those timescales, and this MUST change.
attributes.additional_details:
Having faced two SEN tribunals to date, I'm faced with another battle. 
The Local Authority SEN department procedures for issuing EHC plans, are governed by statutory guidelines, and also guidelines determined by Sendist Tribunal. 

However, Local Authority's are not held accountable for either timescales and as in my case exceed them by an excessive amount of time with no accountability. Local Authority's MUST be made legally accountable for unjust and unfair delays to securing SEN support.

attributes.action: Make Mental Health First Aid courses more accessible regarding location and cost
attributes.background: Mental Health First Aid courses teach how to identify the signs of key mental health issues, provide initial help and capably guide someone towards suitable support. Despite its benefits, many people haven't heard of MHFA; the course is not affordable for all (£300 per person) and centres are scarce
attributes.additional_details:
Mental ill health costs companies £26 billion and affects 25% of people, while the annual cost to the NHS is predicted to double over the next 20 years from £105 billion. With fast diagnosis and application of viable treatment, this could be alleviated.
Our NCS Social Action project (government scheme run by Catch 22) aims to increase MHFA accessibility, thus enhancing mental health care and awareness, developing community support by removing stigmas and advancing knowledge.
www.mhfaengland.org
